channel.title: jumpstartEU | Sven Franck
channel.description: On this site you can learn about me and my political priorities. The most active sections are my blog and jumpstartEU â€“ an initiative to find ways to relaunch the European project.

item.title: If Germany can live with Eurobonds, Denmark can pave the way for EU military
item.dc:creator: Sven Franck
item.description: After the staccato of docile statements from EU and national leaders on Venezuela, Trump has its eyes firmly set on Greenland. Denmark, meanwhile, refused EU and member states military support months ago. With reality biting, isn't it time to reconsider?

item.title: First we take Maduro, then we take Greenland?
item.dc:creator: Sven Franck
item.description: With the US not being coy about its objections to a United Europe, member states having nuclear arms and limiting free speech, one has to wonder when Denmark will loose Greenland or helicopters will exfiltrate Emmanuel Macron after Marine LePen is declared ineligible for the 2027 presidential elections. Are we ready for MAGA-foreign policy?

item.title: 2026: European leadership wanted!
item.dc:creator: Sven Franck
item.description: Any EU aficionado doom-scrolling down to 2026 likely stumbled over the EU Commission self-congratulating itself on its major achievement of the year: the USB-C plug. At this make or break moment of the European Union, one would hope, that our Commission President would boldly aim for the stars to at least land us on the moon of treaty change. Not happening...

item.title: Frozen assets: from Moscow with love
item.dc:creator: Sven Franck
item.description: The temperature is rising ahead of Thursday's European Council on funding #Ukraine for 2026 and 2027. With the principal question being if and how to "unfreeze" the 210Bâ‚¬ of Russian assets held by Belgian Euroclear to fund Ukraine defense and reconstruction. Both Russia threatening legal action and the US seeking control over spending are pressuring our national leaders to coy.

item.title: How about a European Security Strategy?
item.dc:creator: Sven Franck
item.description: The last week has been a revelation for transatlantists with the publication of the US National Security Strategy and Elon Musk, disgruntled by a 140Mâ‚¬ fine for violating the Digital Service Act, calling for the EU to be dissolved. Europe's response: we're BFF, always have, always will. Really?

item.title: Rave, rave into the dying of the light?
item.dc:creator: Sven Franck
item.description: JÃ¼rgen Habermas assessed that "further political integration, at least at the core of the European Union, has never been as vital to our survival as it is today. And never so unlikely". I'm siding with Dylan Thomas "to not go gentle into that good night" instead.

item.title: Why can Trump propose EU legislation and the Parliament can't?
item.dc:creator: Sven Franck
item.description: The EU Commissionâ€™s omnibus shows who holds influence in Europe. If we professionalise the way we collect signatures, we could counterbalance that with ECIs.

item.title: European democracy: how's that gonna work?
item.dc:creator: Sven Franck
item.description: I'm currently trying a first: putting a member motion on the Volt Europa General Assembly agenda this November. It means figuring out how to campaign for a topic across borders and how a European democracy could function.

item.title: European Groundhog day: will we ever wake up?
item.dc:creator: Sven Franck
item.description: If you are a Europe aficionado or among the record high population that believes more Europe is kinda warranted, you must also start to believe we are in the equivalent of a European Groundhog day.

item.title: Trouble in France
item.dc:creator: Sven Franck
item.description: After Prime Minister Bayrou's budget-harakiri, President Macron quickly appointed defence minister SÃ©bastien Lecornu as new prime minister. One has to wonder how many aces he has left in his sleeve considering passing a similar budget will likely mean a similar fate for the new prime minister.

item.title: A Europe of Nations? ðŸ¤¨ No thanks!
item.dc:creator: Sven Franck
item.description: Giorgia Meloni did not want the spotlight to be stolen from her at the recent Rimini Meeting. Contrary to Mario Draghi pleading for European integration she was championing a Europe of Nations. As if more of the status quo is suddenly the solution.

item.title: ChatControl: the end of the secrecy of correspondence
item.dc:creator: Sven Franck
item.description: Even if 72% of the European population is against it, total surveillance of our digital communication risks becoming a near reality. Best we end the secrecy of correspondence with it.

item.title: SOTEU 2026: Cut the sweet talk
item.dc:creator: Sven Franck
item.description: Everything has been said about the White House summit but if one thing is clear after the NATO summit, the US-EU trade deal and last weekend, it's that the EU has some serious introspection to do followed by some equally serious reforming.

item.title: Fork the EU
item.dc:creator: Sven Franck
item.description: Why not fork the EU? Because whatever your dream of a future European Union, any changes to treaties will require unanimity and there will always be someone saying no. Like in software, the threat of a fork creates leverage.

item.title: EU Budget: Pennies for the Dollar?
item.dc:creator: Sven Franck
item.description: Yesterday, Commission President Ursula von der Leyen presented the new EU budget (MFF) to be negotiated over the next 24 months with an increase to 1.984 Trillion â‚¬ or 1.26% of Gross National Income (GNI) - up from 1.13% for the ongoing period.

item.title: Innovation or Bureaucracy?
item.dc:creator: Sven Franck
item.description: I recently submitted a dossier for the European Defence Fund. Our SME consortium passed the threshold with high grades for innovation. However, another project scored better and since only one project was funded, we found ourselves accepted but sans budget.

item.title: Motion of Censure: Decommissioning the Commission President?
item.dc:creator: Sven Franck
item.description: Last week a Romanian MEP from the ECR group tabled a motion of censure against Commission President Ursula von der Leyen for her role in the Pfizergate scandal and interference in German and Romanian elections.

item.title: Border controls are like national parties
item.dc:creator: Sven Franck
item.description: This weekend my green consciousness had me taking the bus from Ljubljana to Munich to catch a direct train to Utrecht. However, reducing exposure to Deutsche Bahn's punctuality does not save travellers from the new German government's paneuropean-domino of illegal border controls.

item.title: 5% Nato spending
item.dc:creator: Sven Franck
item.description: It's Nato summit and Mark Rutte already spoiled the poetic message: We will be spending 5% of GDP on defense. That's significantly more than the 2% members committed to grow their spending until 2024.

item.title: The case for an EU Foreign Policy Trilogue
item.dc:creator: Sven Franck
item.description: I recently watched Jeffrey Sachs speaking in the EU Parliament and I can only echo the criticism towards the European Union lacking a proper foreign policy.
